comment: Rancid monstrosity!! Though this has 3 dollar signs, this is one of the cheapest Nikka whiskys in  Japan, so don't be fooled, it's an ultra low-end whisky that is occasionally passed off as a hidden Nikka gem. Just thinking about it makes my mouth feel bad.
Good and sweet with hints of citrus. Reminds me of GlenDronach 18yr, but the after taste is gone within seconds.
A nice cedar nose. And a spiced taste with a brief hint of citrus.
Mike brought this. thought it would be better.
easy to drink,  sweet, but not much else,
Alcohol overpowering, some grain in there, but not pleasant. Grain is sweet, but harsh.
A little thin bodied. Green apple, grain nose. Medium/light oak, fairly short finish. Some ethanol bite. Not bad, could hold up nicely in a highball.
Very strong charred oak right away that gives way to the more sweet sherry flavors at the end. Very nice balance of wood and berries that make it an interesting drink.
Pretty good, not bold, not too flavorful. A basic whiskey.
Easy drink great ending not too much burn
Caramel, honey to the nose. Graham crackers, syrup, oat taste with a weak finish.
Very Scotch like. Smooth with a nice long finish. Notes of citrus and banana, as well as vanilla.

Nose: vanilla and sherry
Palate: a little dull but quickly becomes spicy
Finish: spicy and longish
Incredibly smooth. A really nice, easy drinking profile.
Sweet and an easy drink. Bit of lingering flavour
Nice sweetness.  Reasonable dram.  Liked it
